revised_title: Newton's Involvement in the Alban Francis Affair
tldr: This article examines Isaac Newton's role in the Alban Francis affair, where he opposed the arbitrary demands of King James II to introduce a Papist, Alban Francis, as a Master of Arts at the University of Cambridge. Newton's involvement in the resistance against the royal policy led to the trial of the seven bishops and the King's downfall. The article discusses the evidence and documents related to Newton's stance on the issue and his influence on the outcome.
